Configuration

Task Configuration

go through an example of how to set task config

The task configuration files are named AHF_task_[name].jsn.

Below is a description of each field in the task configuration (table scrolls horizontally).

Task Configuration File Description

properties

  • BrainLightClass

The BrainLight class used by the task. Must be an extant implementation; currently, only AHF_BrainLight_1GPIO is implemented.

type

string

examples

AHF_BrainLight_1GPIO

  • BrainLightDict

BrainLightDict contains parameters used by the brain light.

type

object

properties

  • ledDelay

The delay time (in seconds) when starting up and turning off the brain light.

type

number

examples

3.0

  • ledPin

The pin used by the brainlight LED.

type

integer

examples

23

  • CameraClass

The CameraClass class used by the task. Must be an extant implementation; currently, only AHF_Camera_PiCam is implemented.

type

string

examples

AHF_Camera_PiCam

  • CameraDict

CameraDict contains parameters used for the camera.

type

object

properties

  • format

The format of the video recorded.

type

string

examples

h264

  • framerate

The framerate of the video.

type

integer

examples

30

  • iso

The iso of the camera.

type

integer

examples

0

  • previewWin

The size of the preview window

type

array

items

A Schema

type

integer

examples

0

640

480

  • quality

The quality of the video

type

integer

examples

20

  • resolution

The camera resolution

type

array

examples

256

256

items

A Schema

type

integer

examples

256

  • shutter_speed

The shutter speed

type

integer

examples

30000

  • video_path

The path to save the video to

type

string

examples

/mnt/AHF_Videos/

  • whiteBalance

whether white balance should be enabled

type

boolean

examples

False

  • ContactCheckClass

The ContactCheckClass. Can be one of AHF_ContactCheck_BeamBreak and AHF_ContactCheck_Elec

type

string

examples

AHF_ContactCheck_BeamBreak

  • ContactCheckDict

Parameters for ContactCheck.

type

object

properties

  • contactPUD

Whether the contact checker is pull-up or pull-down. One of PUD_OFF, PUD_DOWN, PUD_UP.

type

string

examples

PUD_UP

  • contactPin

GPIO pin of the contact detector.

type

integer

examples

12

  • contactPolarity

The polarity of contact checker. Either RISING or FALLING

type

string

examples

FALLING

  • ledPin

The GPIO pin of the contact check LED.

type

integer

examples

24

  • DataLoggerClass

The DataLogger class used by the task. One of AHF_DataLogger_localsql, AHF_DataLogger_mysql, AHF_DataLogger_text, AHF_DataLogger_textMySql

type

string

examples

AHF_DataLogger_textMySql

  • DataLoggerDict

The DataLoggerDict Schema

type

object

properties

  • DB

The database name.

type

string

examples

AHF_home_cage

  • DBhost

The database host address.

type

string

examples

142.103.107.236

  • DBpwd

The database password.

type

string

examples

*******************

  • DBuser

The database username.

type

string

examples

slavePi

  • cageID

The cageID.

type

string

examples

cage1

  • dataPath

The dataPath to save logs to.

type

string

examples

/mnt/AHF_Videos/

  • localDatabase

The local database name.

type

string

examples

raw_data

  • localPassword

The password of the local user.

type

string

examples

AutoHead2015

  • localUser

The username of the local user.

type

string

examples

pi

  • mouseConfigPath

The path to mouse configurations.

type

string

examples

/home/pi/Documents/MiceConfig/

  • oldVersion

Whether to use the old version.

type

boolean

examples

True

  • useLocalSql

Whether to use localsql.

type

boolean

examples

True

  • HeadFixerClass

The HeadFixer class. Available are AHF_HeadFixer_PWM_Pi, AHF_HeadFixer_PWM_PCA9685, AHF_HeadFixer_Pistons, AHF_HeadFixer_NoFix

type

string

examples

AHF_HeadFixer_PWM_PCA9685

  • HeadFixerDict

The HeadFixerDict Schema

type

object

properties

  • servoAddress

The address of the servo

type

integer

examples

64

  • servoFixedPosition

The servo position when fully fixed.

type

integer

examples

100

  • servoReleasedPosition

The servo position when fully released.

type

integer

examples

170

  • skeddadleTime

Time (in seconds) mouse has to leave before being headfixed again.

type

number

examples

5.0

  • LickDetectorClass

The LickDetector class used in the task.

type

string

examples

AHF_LickDetector_MPR

  • LickDetectorDict

The parameters used by the LickDetector class.

type

object

properties

  • IRQpin

The IRQ GPIO pin

type

integer

examples

26

  • mprAddress

The mprAddress

type

integer

examples

90

  • touchChans

The MPR channels to detect touches from.

type

array

items

A Schema

type

integer

examples

0

1

2

3

  • touchThresh

The minimum touch value to count as a touch.

type

integer

examples

8

  • unTouchThresh

The maximum touch value before touch is no longer detected.

type

integer

examples

4

  • NotifierClass

The Notifier class used in the task.

type

null

examples

null

  • NotifierDict

The parameters used by the Notifier class.

type

null

examples

null

  • ReaderClass

The RFID Reader class used in the task.

type

string

examples

AHF_Reader_ID

  • ReaderDict

The parameters used by the Reader class.

type

object

properties

  • TIRpin

The TIR GPIO pin.

type

integer

examples

19

  • inChamberTimeLimit

The time limit for mice staying in the chamber.

type

integer

examples

600

  • serialPort

The serial port of the RFID reader.

type

string

examples

/dev/ttyUSB0

default

  • RewarderClass

The Rewarder class used in the task.

type

string

examples

AHF_Rewarder_solenoid_rpi

default

  • RewarderDict

The parameters used by the Rewarder class.

type

object

properties

  • entryRewardDelay

The delay before the mouse is rewarded after entry.

type

number

examples

1.0

  • maxEntryRewards

The maximum times a mouse can receive an entry reward.

type

integer

examples

10000

  • rewardPin

The GPIO pin of the rewarder.

type

integer

examples

13

  • rewards

The rewards Schema

type

object

properties

  • entry

The amount to reward on entry.

type

number

examples

0.4

  • task

The amount to reward on task success.

type

number

examples

0.4

  • test

The test reward amount.

type

number

examples

1.0

  • StimulatorClass

The Stimulator class used in the task. This class contains most of the task logic.

type

string

examples

AHF_Stimulator_LickWithhold

  • StimulatorDict

The parameters of the Stimulator used in the task.

type

object

properties

  • defaultLevel

The task level. The function of the task level will differ per task.

type

integer

examples

0

  • lickWrongTimeout

The delay to wait (in seconds) after incorrect lick.

type

integer

examples

5

  • speakerDuty

The duty cycle of the speaker.

type

number

examples

0.8

default

0.0

  • speakerFreq

The frequency of the speaker.

type

integer

examples

300

  • speakerOffForReward

The speakerOffForReward.

type

number

examples

1.5

  • speakerPin

The GPIO pin of the speaker.

type

integer

examples

25

default

0

  • StimulusClass

The Stimulus class used in the task. One of AHF_Stimulus_VibMotor, AHF_Stimulus_None.

type

string

examples

AHF_Stimulus_VibMotor

  • StimulusDict

The parameters for the Stimulus class.

type

object

properties

  • motorDuty

The duty cycle (power) of the motor.

type

number

examples

1.0

  • motorFreq

The frequency of the motor.

type

integer

examples

300

  • motorPin

The GPIO pin of the motor.

type

integer

examples

27

  • pulseTime

The motor pulse time.

type

number

examples

0.2

  • SubjectsClass

The Subjects class used by the task.

type

string

examples

AHF_Subjects_mice

  • SubjectsDict

The parameters used by the Subjects class.

type

object

examples

inChamberTimeLimit

300

jsonName

_subjects

loadMiceConfigs

provide_json

Mouse Configuration

Individual mouse settings can be modified from the subjects menu in autoheadfix, or directly editing jsn files.

The subject configuration files are named AHF_mice_[tag].jsn.

Below is a description of each field in the subject configuration file.

Mouse Configuration

type

object

properties

  • HeadFixer

HeadFixer: the headfix settings of the mouse

type

object

default

properties

  • headFixTime

Maximum allowed time in chamber for trials.

type

number

  • propHeadFix

Proportion of entries to headfix.

type

number

  • tightnessHeadFix

Tightness of headfixation.

type

integer

  • Rewarder

Rewarder: rewarder settings for the current subject.

type

object

default

properties

  • breakBeamDelay

The minimum delay, in seconds, between beambreaks before rewarding again.

type

integer

  • breakBeamSize

The valve opening duration, in seconds, for break beam rewards.

type

number

  • entryDelay

The delay between successive entry rewards, in seconds.

type

number

  • entrySize

The valve opening duration, in seconds, for entry rewards.

type

number

  • lastBreakBeamTime

The last beam break time.

type

integer

  • lastEntryTime

The last entry time.

type

integer

  • maxBreakBeamRewards

The maximum number of break beam reards given per day.

type

integer

  • maxEntryRewards

The maximum number of entry rewards given per day.

type

integer

  • taskSize

The valve opening duration, in seconds, for task rewards.

type

number

  • totalBreakBeamRewardsToday

Count of the total break beam rewards today.

type

integer

  • totalEntryRewardsToday

Count of the total entry rewards today.

type

integer

  • Stimulator

The Stimulator settings for the mouse.

type

object

default

properties

  • delayTime

The delay time before the mouse should lick after a stimulus, for lick withhold trials.

type

number

  • goLikelihood

The likelihood of a go trial.

type

number

  • lickWithholdTime

The delay time before the mouse should lick after a task begins.

type

number

  • mouseLevel

The default task level to perform on this subject.

type

integer

  • nRewards

Maximum rewards to give in a series of trials.

type

integer

  • responseTime

Time window of time for the mouse to respond to a stimulus.

type

number

  • rewardInterval

*The interval between rewards for the reward task. *

type

integer

  • rewardNoGo

Whether to reward nogo trials.

type

boolean
